Package edu.cornell.gdiac.json

Class InputController

java.lang.Object
edu.cornell.gdiac.json.InputController
public class InputController extends Object
Class for reading player input. This supports both a keyboard and X-Box controller. In previous solutions, we only detected the X-Box controller on start-up. This class allows us to hot-swap in a controller via the new XBox360Controller class.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputController

      public InputController()
      Creates a new input controller The input controller attempts to connect to the X-Box controller at device 0, if it exists. Otherwise, it falls back to the keyboard control.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static InputController getInstance()
      Return the singleton instance of the input controller
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of the input controller

    • getHorizontal

      public float getHorizontal()
      Returns the amount of sideways movement. -1 = left, 1 = right, 0 = still
      Returns:
      the amount of sideways movement.

    • getVertical

      public float getVertical()
      Returns the amount of vertical movement. -1 = down, 1 = up, 0 = still
      Returns:
      the amount of vertical movement.

    • getCrossHair

      public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getCrossHair()
      Returns the current position of the crosshairs on the screen. This value does not return the actual reference to the crosshairs position. That way this method can be called multiple times without any fair that the position has been corrupted. However, it does return the same object each time. So if you modify the object, the object will be reset in a subsequent call to this getter.
      Returns:
      the current position of the crosshairs on the screen.

    • getSwitchGravity

      public boolean getSwitchGravity()

    • didCollect

      public boolean didCollect()
      Returns true if the player inputted some command to collect Bubblegum.

    • didPrimary

      public boolean didPrimary()
      Returns true if the primary action button was pressed. This is a one-press button. It only returns true at the moment it was pressed, and returns false at any frame afterwards.
      Returns:
      true if the primary action button was pressed.

    • didSecondary

      public boolean didSecondary()
      Returns true if the secondary action button was pressed. This is a one-press button. It only returns true at the moment it was pressed, and returns false at any frame afterwards.
      Returns:
      true if the secondary action button was pressed.

    • didShoot

      public boolean didShoot()
      Returns true if the shoot action was pressed. This is a one-press button. It only returns true at the moment it was pressed, and returns false at any frame afterwards.
      Returns:
      true if the shoot button was pressed.

    • readInput

      public void readInput(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle bounds, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 scale)
      Reads the input for the player and converts the result into game logic. The method provides both the input bounds and the drawing scale. It needs the drawing scale to convert screen coordinates to world coordinates. The bounds are for the crosshair. They cannot go outside of this zone.
      Parameters:
      bounds - The input bounds for the crosshair.
      scale - The drawing scale

    • readGamepad

      private void readGamepad(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle bounds, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 scale)
      Reads input from an X-Box controller connected to this computer. The method provides both the input bounds and the drawing scale. It needs the drawing scale to convert screen coordinates to world coordinates. The bounds are for the crosshair. They cannot go outside of this zone.
      Parameters:
      bounds - The input bounds for the crosshair.
      scale - The drawing scale

    • readKeyboard

      private void readKeyboard(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle bounds, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 scale, boolean secondary)
      Reads input from the keyboard. This controller reads from the keyboard regardless of whether or not an X-Box controller is connected. However, if a controller is connected, this method gives priority to the X-Box controller.
      Parameters:
      secondary - true if the keyboard should give priority to a gamepad

    • clampPosition

      private void clampPosition(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle bounds)
      Clamp the cursor position so that it does not go outside the window While this is not usually a problem with mouse control, this is critical for the gamepad controls.
